definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: The children are learning how to count.
The effect of the anomalous magnetic moment of the nucleon on the value of the internal conversion coefficient is investigated.
sentences.chinese: 本文討論核子的反常磁矩對於內轉換系數數值的影響。

sentences.english: Father always tells me to count to ten when i get angry.
sentences.chinese: 當我生氣時，父親總讓我數數到十。

sentences.english: The next example calculates the identity matrix for a given dimension.
sentences.chinese: 下面的例子是計算給定維數數組的單位矩陣。

sentences.english: He unwrapped his pack and the first thing he did was to count his matches.
sentences.chinese: 他打開包袱，第一件事就是數數他的火柴。

sentences.english: The referee started counting over the fallen boxer.
sentences.chinese: 裁判員對着倒在地上的拳擊手開始數數。

sentences.english: I asked the little boy, "Shall we count that money one more time?"
sentences.chinese: 我對小男孩，“咱們再來數數錢好嗎？”
那就意味着它們能數數。

sentences.english: Most of us first learn to count and add on our fingers.
sentences.chinese: 剛開始學習數數和計算時，我們用手指幫助計算。

sentences.english: Wolves can count till 7 and foresee the results of their actions.
sentences.chinese: 野狼可以數數到7，並會預判行爲的後果。

sentences.english: The little girl could only remember her numbers by counting out.
sentences.chinese: 這個小姑娘只有大聲數數，才能記得住數字。

sentences.english: Another way we could estimate innovation is by counting Nobel Laureates.
sentences.chinese: 我們還可以通過數數諾貝爾獎得主比較一下創新能力。

sentences.english: However, they nearly all counted in the same way-in tens.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他們幾乎都用相同的方式數數，都是十進制。

sentences.english: My own research can convinience it that they have this ability from birth.
sentences.chinese: 我們自己的研究證明他們從出生就會數數了。

sentences.english: It also meant that he counted obsessively when he walked.
sentences.chinese: 這還意味着他會一邊走路一邊發狂地數數。

sentences.english: Dorothy, please. We're trying to count.
sentences.chinese: 桃樂絲，求你了，我們正在數數。

definition: to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to get sth done once and for all
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
to pull a face/to grimace/to scowl
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
